views.markdown:
Compatible with iOS 8, 9 and 10 (tested on iPhone 5S, 6 and 7 running iOS 8.3, 9.0.2 and 10.1.1).

SwipeUpAndDown gives you the Way to Swipe Up for Closing the Current Applications, then Swipe Down to Retrieve Again All of Them and More!

On iOS 9 and 10 you have to Scroll to the Next Application for being Able to Swipe Up and Retrieve them Again.

The Applications once Closed Still Remain Visible When Scrolling Across the Switcher but will be Closed When opening It Again (The Explanation is also on the Preferences of the Tweak).

Furthermore, SwipeUpAndDown has also at the moment these Additional Features:

- Hide the Icons of the Switcher Cards.

- Hide the Icons and the Labels of the Switcher Cards.

- Enable the Switcher to Always Open the Current Application!

- Make Small the Icons and the Labels of the Switcher Cards.

More Stuff to come!

Configure options from Settings.

See Screenshots and the Video about How It Works below.

iOS 11 is on Full Compatibility Stage in the Next Works.

Feel free to contact me via Mail or via Twitter @CydiaGeek, enjoy it, thanks! :)

would be greatly appreciated!
